text.section: In this Part VII of this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Child" means an individual under the age of 16 years.

section.section: "Child care center" means an agency, institution, or establishment that, for part or all of a day, or on a 24-hour basis on a regular schedule, and at least twice a week, offers or provides child care to children who do not have the same parentage except as otherwise provided for in law or regulation.
"Child care center" shall include a nonpublic nursery school in which an instructional program is offered or provided for children who are under the age of 5 years.

text.section: "Department" means the State Department of Education.
"Letter of compliance" means a letter issued by the State Department of Education to a religious organization that meets the requirements under § 5-573 of this subtitle.
"License" means a license issued by the State Department of Education to operate a child care center.
"Person" includes a State, county, or municipal corporation.
"State Superintendent" means the State Superintendent of Schools or the State Superintendent's designee.
